taxonConcepts.nameAccordingTo: Species 2000 & ITIS Catalogue of Life: April 2013
IUCN Red List (Species Assessed for Global Conservation)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Medium sized fish considered to be the most southern characid living in temperate waters.  Young with very tiny soft and delicate scales which are reabsorbed into the skin making the skin greasy and often with granulated or spongy appearance (Ref. 7252).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: South America:  Valcheta stream in Rio Negro basin, Southern Argentina.
dataObjects.references: Ortubay, S. and V. Cussac 2000 Threatened fishes of the world: Gymnocharacinus bergi Steindachner, 1903 (Characidae). Environ. Biol. Fish. 58:144. (Ref. 35685)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: Valcheta Creek, Somuncurá Plateau, Negro River dranage, southern Argentina.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Morphology
dataObjects.description: Dorsal spines (total): 0; Dorsal soft rays (total): 12;  Analspines: 0; Analsoft rays: 19

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#DiagnosticDescription
dataObjects.description: Entirely naked (scale only shown on lateral line in specimens > 5 cm TL; head profile obtuse.  Color is dark brown, greenish, the belly is cream; there is a copper-colored band on the flanks (Ref. 35685).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Uses
dataObjects.title: Importance
dataObjects.description: fisheries: of no interest; aquarium: commercial
